entry.title: Rajasthan ranks highest in LED streetlighting deployment

link.title: Rajasthan ranks highest in LED streetlighting deployment

entry.content: Rajasthan has installed more LED streetlights (700,000) than any other state. The nation overall has replaced 2.1 million conventional street lights with LEDs, resulting in annual energy savings of 295 million units. Andhra Pradesh came second with 586,000 LED streetlights.

entry.title: No special government power subsidy for agricultural consumers in Maharashtra

link.title: No special government power subsidy for agricultural consumers in Maharashtra

entry.content: Maharashtra has decided not to grant an additional ‘special’ government subsidy to agricultural electricity consumers, meaning that such consumers could see a 100 percent rise in their electricity bills this year. The government will still provide the standard subsidy of about 3 cents per unit to metered customers.

The government will still provide the standard subsidy of about 3 cents per unit to metered customers.

entry.title: Madhya Pradesh inaugurates first rooftop plant with net metering capability

link.title: Madhya Pradesh inaugurates first rooftop plant with net metering capability

entry.content: Madhya Pradesh inaugurated its first rooftop solar plant with net metering capability. The 1.97 kilowatt capacity plant is located on the roof of a private home in Indore.

entry.title: Haryana extends deadline for consumers to pay their electricity bills

link.title: Haryana extends deadline for consumers to pay their electricity bills

entry.content: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar gave consumers with outstanding electricity bills another chance to pay what they owe without paying a late fee. The “Surcharge Waiver Scheme 2017” will last the entire month of May. It follows an identical amnesty in 2016.

entry.title: Haryana effectively stops distribution of kerosene, encourages LPG

link.title: Haryana effectively stops distribution of kerosene, encourages LPG

entry.content: As of April 1, Haryana no longer distributes kerosene through the Public Distribution System, instead encouraging households to switch to liquefied petroleum gas (LPG). The state had connected 273,000 households to the LPG grid free of charge by the end of March 2017 and has budgeted $3 million to connect the remaining households.

entry.title: Bangladesh will now be able to import 1600 MW from Jharkhand

link.title: Bangladesh will now be able to import 1600 MW from Jharkhand

entry.content: Bangladesh’s Cabinet Committee on Public Purchase has approved the import of electricity from a 1600 MW power plant in Jharkhand, India, even though per unit prices are higher than the norm. The Bangladeshi government had decided to import electricity from Jharkhand at a price of 8.6 US cents per unit for the next 25 years.

entry.title: Assam to work with the Indo-German Energy Programme to revamp the state’s power sector

link.title: Assam to work with the Indo-German Energy Programme to revamp the state's power sector

entry.content: Assam government has sought assistance from the Indo-German Energy Programme (IGEN) to revamp the power sector of the state. IGEN, an initiative of the German Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development, executes energy security programmes in developing countries. Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal sought IGEN’s help to establish a stable power supply and reduce transmission losses.

entry.title: Andhra bans thermal power addition till 2022, boost to renewable options

link.title: Andhra bans thermal power addition till 2022, boost to renewable options

entry.content: Andhra Pradesh has decided to ban development of new thermal power plants until at least 2022 in an attempt to foster development of renewable options. Andhra Pradesh already has 1,867 megawatts (MW) of renewable power generating capacity.

entry.title: Tata Power signs DF agreement for Ajmer

link.title: Tata Power signs DF agreement for Ajmer

entry.content: Tata Power has signed a Distribution Franchise Agreement with one of Rajasthan’s discoms to handle electricity distribution in Ajmer. Tata Power formed a special purpose company, TP Ajmer Distribution Ltd., to execute the 20-year contract.

entry.title: Suzlon to build new wind power project in Madhya Pradesh

link.title: Suzlon to build new wind power project in Madhya Pradesh

entry.content: Suzlon Group has won a 100.8 megawatt (MW) order from ReNew Power Ventures for the latter’s Limbwas wind power project in Madhya Pradesh. Suzlon will install 48 wind turbine generators with a capacity of 2.1 MW each.
